column12: BIOCHAR GENERATOR AND ASSOCIATED METHODS
column13: A biochar generator may include a pyrolysis chamber, a heater connected to the pyrolysis chamber and a biochar collection chamber in communication with the pyrolysis chamber. A biochar collection chamber sensor may sense a composition of the biochar collected in the biochar collection chamber to define a sensed composition of the biochar. A controller in electrical communication with the biochar collection chamber sensor may utilize the sensed composition of the biochar to dynamically alter conditions in the pyrolysis chamber to alter the composition of the biochar.

column12: Preparation process and equipment of biochar
column13: The invention discloses preparation equipment of biochar. The equipment is mainly used for solving the problems of fuel waste and environment pollution in the biochar preparation process in the prior art. The preparation equipment comprises a biochar cracking furnace, a bio-oil preparation box communicated with the biochar cracking furnace, and discharging equipment connected with the biochar cracking furnace and used for discharging biochar in the biochar cracking furnace, and the biochar cracking furnace comprises a biochar cracking furnace body, a biochar discharge port formed in the bottom of the biochar cracking furnace body, a plugging device used for plugging the biochar discharge port and capable of being locked on a cover body, a communicating pipe arranged on the biochar cracking furnace body, a feed port formed in the biochar cracking furnace body, a power switch arranged on the charcoal cracking furnace body, and a pressure control device arranged on the charcoal cracking furnace body. By means of the scheme, the purposes of energy conservation and environment protection are achieved, and high practical value and popularization value are achieved.

column12: ACTIVATION METHOD OF BIOCHAR USING ACID TREATMENT, ACID ACTIVATED BIOCHAR AND PREPARING METHOD THEREOF
column13: The present invention relates to a method for activating biochar comprising a step of treating biochar with acid, biochar activated by the same, a method for manufacturing activated biochar, and a method for adsorbing antibiotics from soil using the activated biochar. According to the method for activating the biochar of the present invention, the biochar having dramatically increased BET surface area and pore volume compared to those of the conventional biochar can be manufactured, and in case of applying the biochar activated by the activation method to the soil polluted by antibiotics, the activated biochar has an excellent antibiotics adsorptive effect, thereby effectively adsorbing and removing the antibiotics compared to the conventional method using biochar.

column12: Magnetic biochar and preparation method thereof
column13: The invention discloses magnetic biochar and a preparation method thereof. The preparation method comprises the steps: carbonizing a biomass material to prepare biochar, then mixing the biochar with anitric acid solution to prepare acid-modified biochar, and mixing the acid-modified biochar with an alkaline mixed solution of FeCl3 and FeCl2 under the protection of inert gas to prepare the magnetic biochar. According to the method, the biochar is modified by nitric acid, so that the metal adsorption performance of the biochar is improved; meanwhile, Fe3O4 is modified on the surface of the acid-modified biochar to obtain the magnetic biochar; and after sewage is treated, the magnetic biochar is easily separated from water, so that regeneration and cyclic utilization of the magnetic biocharare facilitated.

column12: Modified biochar material, preparation method and application thereof
column13: The invention discloses a modified biochar material, a preparation method and application thereof. The modified biochar material includes biochar and a modifier modifying the surface of the biochar. The biochar comprises rice husk biochar, and the modifier includes sulfur powder. A high temperature calcination method is employed to prepare the biochar material, and the steps include: subjecting the biochar raw materials to high temperature calcinations in an inert atmosphere, then performing natural cooling to room temperature, and conducting drying so as to obtain the biochar material. The modified biochar material provided by the invention has the characteristics of simple preparation method, improved Hg contaminated soil restoration capability, mild action conditions and no secondary pollution.

column12: Biochar-based adsorbent for removing organic pollutants in sewage
column13: The invention discloses a biochar-based adsorbent for removing organic pollutants in sewage. The biochar-based adsorbent is composed of large-particle biochar, medium-particle biochar and small-particle biochar, the particle size of the large-particle biochar is larger than 20 meshes, the particle size of the small-particle biochar is smaller than or equal to 60 meshes, and the particle size of the medium-particle biochar is smaller than or equal to 20 meshes and larger than 60 meshes. Sewage containing organic matter pollution sequentially flows through the large-particle biochar, the medium-particle biochar and the small-particle biochar. The biochar-based adsorbent is beneficial to reducing the sewage treatment cost and the process operation difficulty and improving the effluent qualitystability.

column12: Biochar filtration system for high-nitrogen wastewater treatment and operation way of biochar filtration system
column13: The invention discloses a biochar filtration system for high-nitrogen wastewater treatment. The biochar filtration system comprises four layers of different biochar layers; the biochar layers are filled from top to bottom and are respectively a large-particle biochar layer, a biochar/sponge composite layer, a biochar/clay mineral composite layer and an activated biochar layer. The whole filtrationsystem is divided into three layers including an aerobic region, an anoxic-anaerobic region and an anaerobic region from top to bottom, nitrogenous pollutants in sewage are adsorbed by biochar on onehand and are utilized for nitration and denitrification on the other hand. The biochar filtration system is simple and practicable in process requirements and equipment investment, free of high-poweraeration equipment, free of professional environment-friendly equipment for system establishment, short in construction period and low in construction and operation costs.

The preparation method of the super-hydrophobic/lipophilic biochar foam comprises the following steps that melamine foam is placed in biochar turbid liquid, so that biochar powder in the biochar turbid liquid is loaded on the melamine foam, drying is conducted, and biochar foam is obtained; and the biochar foam is immersed into a molybdic acid aqueous solution, the biochar foam is taken out, and drying is conducted to obtain the super-hydrophobic/lipophilic biochar foam. The oil-water mixture is a mixture of an organic substance and water, the organic substance is dichloromethane, styrene, o-xylene, normal hexane or petroleum ether. The adsorption capacity of the super-hydrophobic/lipophilic biochar foam to organic matter in the oil-water mixture reaches 132-233 g/g.

column12: Biochar capable of stably curing heavy metals
column13: The invention discloses a biochar capable of stably curing heavy metals. The biochar is prepared by adsorbing the heavy metals in polluted water by utilizing the high enrichment of aquatic plants, and co-pyrolyzing the aquatic plants enriched with the heavy metals and clay minerals. In-situ adsorption is adopted, the heavy metal is coated or enriched in the biochar, the migration time of the heavy metal is prolonged, and the biochar is very stable. Meanwhile, in the process of preparing the biochar, attapulgite and montmorillonite are used as clay minerals to be loaded in the biochar, heavy metal contained in the biochar plays a certain catalytic role and has a synergistic effect with the activated attapulgite, the reliability of the biochar is improved, and the ecological effectiveness and potential risk of the heavy metal in the biochar are effectively reduced.

column12: Preparation method of modified biochar
column13: The invention discloses a preparation method of modified biochar. The preparation method comprises the following steps: 1) taking an appropriate amount of biochar, adding a mixed liquor of concentrated sulfuric acid and concentrated nitric acid, stirring for a while, filtering, washing with water and drying the mixture to obtain nitrated biochar; 2) adding water and a reducing agent in the nitrated biochar obtained from the step 1), stirring, raising the temperature, and then carrying out backflow, when the reactant is cooled, filtering, washing with water and drying the reactant to obtain the modified biochar. The method is simple and easy to produce industrially. Compared with the conventional biochar or the biochar similar adsorbent technology, the adsorptive property of the prepared modified biochar to heavy metal is greatly improved, considerable stability is realized, and the modified biochar can be desorbed and regenerated after adsorption and recycled.

column13: The invention provides for methods, devices, and systems for pyrolyzing biomass. A pyrolysis unit can be used for the pyrolysis of biomass to form gas, liquid, and solid products. The biomass materials can be selected such that an enhanced biochar is formed after pyrolysis. The biomass can be pyrolyzed under specified conditions such that a selected biochar core is formed. The biochar or biochar core can be functionalized to form a functionalized biochar or functionalized biochar core. column12: Biochar preparation method, biochar and structuring process method thereof
column13: The invention discloses a biochar preparation method, which belongs to the field of ecological restoration and sewage treatment, and comprises the following steps: mixing typha orientalis and sludge, oscillating and dipping the obtained mixture and an activator solution, and then carbonizing and crushing to obtain typha orientalis-based biochar powder. The biochar has the characteristic of structuralization, and the problem that former biochar is difficult to form is solved; the biochar can form a cube shape, a lotus shape, a grid shape and the like, so that the biochar has a landscape effect while having a treatment capability in a water environment treatment process.

column12: Device and method for preparing granular biochar fuel
column13: The invention relates to the technical field of biomass energy, and especially relates to a device and a method for preparing a granular biochar fuel. column12: Enhancing biochar performance using pyrolysis acid stream
column13: A method of producing a modified biochar and the use of the biochar as a soil amendment. The modified biochar can be produced by contacting biochar with an acid-containing solution obtained from an acid containing stream produced in a pyrolysis process, which produces biochar. In accordance with one aspect, a cellulose-containing biomass is pyrolyzed to generate a gaseous organic acid-containing stream, which is condensed to produce an organic acid-containing solution. The biochar is then modified by contact with the organic acid-containing solution.

column12: ELASTOMERIC COMPOSITION REINFORCED WITH GROUND-BIOCHAR
column13: This disclosure provides methods for grinding biochar composition for use as a filler in elastomeric compositions. Such methods include providing a biochar composition comprising particulate, and grinding the biochar composition with a grinding fluid until the biochar is characterized as having an average particulate size less than substantially 1 micrometer. Optionally, such methods may include passivating the biochar composition during or after grinding by covering a sufficient portion of the surface pores sized 10 nanometer and smaller of the particulate forming the ground biochar composition. Curable elastomeric compositions including biochar and cured elastomeric products are also provided.
